content:
• Wednesday, June 20, 2018
  • LMNR

    Limoneira lower on $50M public share offering

    • California agribusiness/real estate firm Limoneira (NASDAQ:LMNR) is off 13.1% in light trading after hours following the announcement of a $50M public stock offering.
    • Those shares are expected to come at $22-$22.50 each, Bloomberg reports; shares had closed at $26.70 (up 2.6%) during the regular session, and are down to $23.20 in late action.
    • Underwriters are expected to get a 30-day greenshoe option for up to an additional 15% of shares.
    • Net proceeds would go to fund an asset acquisition from Fruticola San Pablo.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy -1.8% as Posco terminates MOU

    • FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) -1.8% after-hours as it discloses Posco (NYSE:PKX) will terminate the 2017 memorandum of understanding effective July 15 and exit the fuel cell business.
    • According to the MOU, PKX had expected to support existing South Korean fuel cell installations and commit to a specified level of module purchases from FCEL to supplement its own local manufacturing for servicing its existing fleet.
    • FCEL says it will continue to execute on previously developed fuel cell projects in Korea.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM | 205 Comments

    HP board approves $4B repurchase program

    • HP’s (NYSE:HPQ) board approves a $4B repurchase authorization.
    • As of April 30, HP had approximately $1.2B remaining under a prior authorization. 
    • HP shares are up 3.1% aftermarket to $24.02.

  • VERI

    Veritone -5.1% on proposed share offering

    • Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) is 5.1% lower after hours following its announcement of a public share offering.
    • JMP Securities and Roth Capital Partners will be book-runners.
    • Underwriters are expected to get a 30-day option to buy additional shares at the offering price.

  • WIX

    Wix.com -1.5% on private note offering

    • Wix.com (NASDAQ:WIX) proposes the sale of $350M of senior notes in a private offering. Initial purchasers get a 13-day option for up to $52.5M in additional notes.
    • Wix shares are down 1.5% aftermarket to $106.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • MU

    Micron dips despite Q3 beats; NAND and DRAM shipments flat Q/Q

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) shares drop 0.8% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 40% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • DRAM performance: Accounted for 71% of total revenue with its revenue up 6% Q/Q and 56% Y/Y. Shipment quantities were relatively flat on the quarter and ASPs were up mid-to-upper single-digit percent range.
    • Trade NAND performance: Accounted for 25% of overall revenue with revenue up 8% Q/Q and 14% Y/Y. Shipments were relatively flat on the quarter and ASPs were up mid-to-upper single-digit percentage range.
    • Key metrics: Operating cash flow, $4.3B; FCF, $2.2B; operating expenses; cash and equivalents, $7.7B; total debt balance, $7.3B.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release / Presentation slides
    • Previously: Micron Technology beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (June 20)
    • Update: DRAM/NAND companies that might move on Micron's earnings include Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) and Western Digital (NYSE:WDC).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 189 Comments

  • AOBC

    American Outdoor Brands +6% in post-earnings trading

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC) trades higher after topping QFQ4 estimates amd posting mixed guidance.
    • During FQ4, American Outdoor generated free cash flow of $61.2M and ended the quarter with net debt of $138.8M.
    • The company expects Q1 revenue of $130M to $140M vs. $125.5M consensus and EPS of $0.10 to $0.14 vs $0.02 consensus.
    • Looking ahead to the full fiscal year, American Outdoor guides for revenue of $570M to $600M vs. $618M consensus and EPS of $0.40 to $0.50 vs. $0.63 consensus.
    • AOBC +6.20% AH to $14.05.
    • Previously: American Outdoor Brands beats by $0.14, beats on revenue (June 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • THO

    Big day for RV names after Winnebago's blowout report

    • Winnebago soared 14.9% today after topping Q3 estimates by a mile.
    • Thor Industrues (THO +6.5%), REV Group (REVG +1.5%), LCI Industries (LCII +5.7%), Camping World (CWH +6.8%), Polaris Industries (PII +0.6%)
    • After the close Thor announces the payoff of its $500M revolver and a $250M buyback authorization, with CEO Bob Martin taking note of the "great success" of the Jayco acquisition.

  • AKAO

    Achaogen up 7% ahead of FDA decision of plazomicin

    • Achaogen (AKAO +6.5%) is up on average volume, adding to yesterday's 4% move. Monday, June 25, is the FDA's action date for the company's marketing application seeking approval for plazomicin for the treatment of complicated urinary tract infections (cUTI).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 21 Comments
  • IBM

    Box +3.1% on IBM agreement, high volume

    • IBM (NYSE:IBM) and Box (NYSE:BOX) announce a new offering from IBM to build custom Box Skills that apply Watson AI tech to the Box Skills framework.
    • Box shares are up 3.1% on high volume of 13.3M shares compared to the 4.71M average. 
    • Competitor Dropbox (NASDAQ:DBX) is down 6.2% with no new catalyst with volume of 8.25M compared to the 5.04M average.

    Great Canadian tumbles 14% on bearish Seeking Alpha item

    • "Are Shareholders About To Roll Snake-Eyes," goes the title of a piece by new Seeking Alpha contributor Aletheia Analytics.
    • Aletheia sees 40-64% downside from yesterday's close.
    • Shares today are down 14.5% in Toronto action, and the ADRs (OTCPK:GCGMF) are off 14.3%.

  • SRPT

    Gene therapy players in the green

    • Gene therapy-related stocks are poised to end the session in the green, riding high after Sarepta's (SRPT +7.1%) bullish news yesterday.

  • I

    Intelsat now up 27% with FCC set to vote on C-band usage

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) keeps building on earlier gains, now up 26.8%, after a blog post from FCC Chairman Ajit Pai signals the panel will take up rules July 12 for intensifying C-band satellite spectrum usage.
    • "Our spectrum strategy calls for making low-band, mid-band, and high-band airwaves available for flexible use," Pai writes.
    • Now, headlining the agenda at the FCC’s July meeting is a proposal to make more intensive use of mid-band spectrum from 3.7 to 4.2 GHz, commonly called the C-band," he continues. "... In response to a Notice of Inquiry we initiated last summer, stakeholders have come up with a number of creative ideas for making better use of 3.7 to 4.2 GHz.
    • That's a reference to an idea from Intelsat, SES (OTCPK:SGBAF) and Intel (INTC +1%) to share that C-band spectrum with wireless providers.
    • Previously: Intelsat +9% as RBC raises to Outperform on C-band prospects (Jun. 20 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • CBL

    Retail landlords lead rally in REITs

    • The iShares U.S. Real Estate ETF (IYR +1%) has about doubled the advance of the S&P 500 today. While the 10-year Treasury yield is up three basis points today, it remains sharply lower than a week ago.
    • Leading the advance in REITs are the shopping center and mall names, CBL & Associates (CBL +3.9%), Washington Prime (WPG +3.2%), Kimco (KIM +2.1%), EPR Properties (EPR +2%), Tanger Factory (SKT +2.2%), Simon Property (SPG +1.7%), and Taubman Centers (TCO +2.6%) among them.
    • Triple-net players are also in the green: Realty Income (O +1%), Store Capital (STOR +1.5%), Spirit Realty (SRC +1.2%).
    • Outside retail: Senior Housing (SNH +1.3%), Omega Healthcare (OHI +1.6%), Physicians Realty (DOC +2.6%), Stag Industrial (STAG +1.4%), Government Properties (GOV-OLD +1.9%)
    • ETFs: VNQ, IYR, RQI, SCHH, RNP, RFI, KBWY, DRN, NRO, URE, ICF, XLRE, JRS, RWR, SRS, FREL, DRA, DRV, RIF, LRET, REK, RIT, FRI, FTY, PSR, USRT, WREI, IARAX, RORE, PPTY
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 47 Comments
  • REGN

    Regeneron adds to breakout, up 2%

    • Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +2.4%) is up on average volume. Shares have rallied 8% since touching $309.71 two days ago. Today, there has been renewed (drumroll please) takeover chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 13 Comments
  • FB

    Instagram hits 1B users, launches IGTV

    • Instagram (FB +2.7%) has launched a long-form video hub -- IGTV -- that marks its bid to capture teen-age eyeballs who have shifted consumption to online creators from television.
    • The service gives users the ability to upload videos of up to an hour. That's a significant bump from 60-second video uploads and video stories of 15 seconds.
    • “Teens may be watching less TV, but they are watching more creators online,” says Instagram CEO Kevin Systrom.
    • Meanwhile, Instagram has hit 1B monthly active users, it says; that's the first major update since it passed 800M MAUs last (and 500M daily active users) last September.
    • Previously: WSJ: Instagram readying long-form user video posting (Jun. 05 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 58 Comments
  • ATRX

    New chief at Marina Biotech; shares up 4%

    • Marina Biotech (MRNA +3.7%) appoints Robert Moscato as CEO succeeding interim chief Vuong Trieu, Ph.D, who resigned. Previously, he was President & COO at Cerecor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • LTBR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/20/2018)

    • Gainers: LTBR +8%. UPL +8%. DNR +7%. SAEX +7%. CRC +7%.
    • Losers: GEVO -34%. TANH -10%. SDR -8%. SHI -7%. NOG -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • SQ

    Square gains 3%, PayPal rises 2%--both reach all-time highs

    • Square (SQ +4%) keeps attaining new highs, with today's bump helped by Evercore ISI analyst Rayna Kumar boosting price target to $73 from $64.
    • Square touched an all-time high of $68.88, about double since the beginning of the year.
    • Paypal's  (PYPL +2%) gain follows its announcement after the close of trading yesterday that it will shell out $400M to acquire Hyperwallet.
    • The deal will strengthen PayPal's use in marketplace businesses. Hyperwallet specializes in the disbursements that ride-sharing companies pay their drivers or home-sharing companies pay their hosts.
    • While PayPal also attained a new high today--$86.97--its ascent has been a bit choppier; for example, PYPL reached $86.32 on Jan. 31, then fell as low as $71.63 on Feb. 9.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 10 Comments
  • DIS

    Bloomberg: Disney nears antitrust OK on Fox bid, a blow to Comcast

    • Disney (NYSE:DIS) returned to an upswing, now up 1%, on a Bloomberg report that it's close to U.S. antitrust approval on its bid for media assets at Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX +7.3%, FOXA +7.3%), a setback to Comcast's pursuit of those assets.
    • Comcast (CMCSA +1.8%) is on its own choppy spike amid a report that it's offering $41/share for the Fox assets, a topper to Disney's $38/share bid.
    • The Justice Dept. could approve Disney's deal in as soon as two weeks, a source tells David McLaughlin, adding that that would include Disney selling some assets to seal the deal.
    • "We are already six months into the regulatory process and we are confident we have a clear and timely path to approval,” Disney CEO Bob Iger told analysts this morning.
    • Previously: Jefferies: Comcast will counter in low-$40s for Fox assets (Jun. 20 2018)
    • Previously: Fox up 5% after boosted bid by Disney (Jun. 20 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 23 Comments
  • MSFT

    Microsoft acquires machine learning startup for autonomous systems

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) acquires machine learning startup Bonsai to help build “brains” for autonomous systems. Terms weren’t disclosed.
    • Bonsai uses machine learning that abstracts low-level mechanics so that subject matter experts lacking AI aptitude can specify and train autonomous systems. The training takes place in a simulated environment. 
    • Bonsai’s platform can benefit enterprises using industrial control systems such as robotics, HVAC manufacturing, and general autonomous systems. 
    • The startup’s platform will combine with the tools in Microsoft Research for a toolchain that will compose with Azure Machine Learning on the Azure Cloud.
    • Microsoft shares are up 1.2% to $102.10.  
    • Previously: Microsoft announces two datacenter regions in Norway, Equinor agreement (June 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 10 Comments
  • ESTR

    Estre Ambiental down 6% post FY results

    • Estre Ambiental (ESTR -6%) reports FY revenue decrease of 1.4% Y/Y to R$1.4B, the decrease was mainly due to a decline in revenues from the Oil and Gas segment, resulting from reduced activity in the oil sector in Brazil.
    • Landfills revenues increased by 1.2% Y/Y to R$450M & Collection and Cleaning Services revenues increased by 0.7% Y/Y to R$922M.
    • Adj. EBITDA increased 7.3% Y/Y to R$414M, which increased margin by 200 bps to 30%. Adj. EBITDA less Capex was R$270M (+1.7% Y/Y).
    • Adj. operating costs decreased by 7.4% Y/Y to R$817M, this improvement was due to cost management and operational improvements, particularly in the landfills business.
    • Adj. operating expenses increased by 7.4% Y/Y to R$134M, this increase was mainly impacted by a net reversal in the allowance for doubtful accounts in 2016 compared to an increase in 2017.
    • Indebtedness: Working Capital of R$360M; Gross Financial Debt of R$1.5B (-14% Y/Y); Cash and equivalents of R$85M (+172.5% Y/Y); Net Financial Debt of R$1.4B (-17.5% Y/Y); Total Net Debt of R$1.9B (-11.8% Y/Y) & Total Net Debt to Adj. EBITDA of 4.7x.
    • The company completed its business combination with Boulevard Acquisition Corp II, and received a cash investment of US$140M as a result of the transaction.  The majority of the proceeds were used to reduce and to restructure the Company’s debt, resulting in a Net Financial Debt/EBITDA leverage of 3.3x.
    • Outlook: Adj. EBITDA margins to return to the mid 20% & revenues in the H1 2018 to grow 7-8%.
    • Previously: Estre Ambiental reports FY results (June 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • CWH

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/20/2018)

  • FOX

    Jefferies: Comcast will counter in low-$40s for Fox assets

    • With Disney (DIS -0.1%) having boosted its bid for media assets at Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX +7.3%, FOXA +7.3%) to $38/share, one analyst now expects Comcast (CMCSA -1.1%) to come back with a low-$40s bid.
    • Jefferies' John Janedis expects Comcast -- locked in a high-stakes bidding war for 21CF entertainment properties -- to return with that as a counter-offer.
    • There's no timetable, so with Disney's higher bid fresh in the news, the waiting game goes on. Fox has suspended its shareholder meeting indefinitely as the bids play out.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 26 Comments
  • LFIN

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/20/2018)

    • Gainers: OTCPK:LFIN +40%. ADOM +38%. AETI +35%. CLBS +32%. FUV +26%. FORD +25%. DAC +24%. CLPS +24%. I +23%. LBIX-OLD +17%.

    | 12:50 PM
  • FB

    Facebook launching test of subscription groups

    • Facebook (FB +3%) is testing a new revenue stream, allowing administrators of its Groups to charge subscriptions of $4.99-$29.99/month for limited access to exclusive sub-Groups.
    • The company isn't taking a cut of that money during the test, but could move toward monetizing a feature with more than a billion users.
    • The first groups to see the feature include a hand-picked set of parenting, cooking and home organization Groups.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 41 Comments
  • FORD

    Internet of Things catches up with beer

    • Forward industries’ (FORD +23.9%) subsidiary Intelligent Product Solutions has partnered with AB InBev's (BUD +0.5%) division ZX Ventures to develop an Internet connected beer vending machine called the "BeerBox".
    • The machine “BeerBox” will dispense ice cold beer cans, have internet connectivity for payment processing and accept all major credit cards and mobile wallets.
    • "Instead of standing in long lines at a music festivals and sporting events, the BeerBox makes it much more convenient to purchase a beer and helps concessioners increase sales - it really doubles as a bar," said BeerBox founder Robert Gaafar.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 17 Comments
  • PSSR

    PASSUR Aerospace up 3.5% post Q2 results

    • PASSUR Aerospace (OTCQB:PSSR) reports Q2 revenue growth of 2.3% Y/Y to $3.5M, the increase in revenues was primarily related to an increase in consulting revenue of $74K.
    • The company continues to invest $2M in new software development, S&M, and business leaders needed to achieve its projected future strategic and growth objectives.
    • As a result of this increase in operating expenses, the company incurred significant losses and derived a net loss of $1M.
    • The company completed and deployed its Surface Management System, including PASSUR Surface Surveillance Technology.
    • "PASSUR continues to position itself to lead in the digitization of aviation operations," said Jim Barry, President & CEO.
    • Previously: PASSUR Aerospace reports Q2 results (June 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • KZIA

    Kazia Therapeutics continues selloff, down 17%

    • Ultra-thinly traded nano cap Kazia Therapeutics (KZIA -17%) is down on double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 34K shares. The stock has shed almost a third of its value since touching $5.40 on June 14.
    • Yesterday, it announced preliminary data from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing Cantrixil in women with treatment-resistant ovarian cancer. Eight patients remain on study with five evaluable for efficacy. Three of the five experienced stable cancer (Cantrixil alone) while one showed a partial response (Cantrixil + chemo).
    • The independent Data Monitoring Committee has recommended increased enrollment to better characterize Cantrixil's safety profile and maximum tolerated dose. The conclusion of Part A of the study should happen next quarter.
    • The company says Cantrixil targets the entire spectrum of cancer cells by virtue of its action against cancer stem cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • AETI

    American Electric jumps 36% on $3M project

    • American Electric's (AETI +36.3%) M&I Electric business has been awarded a $3M contract to provide a power delivery solution for a new North America-deployed offshore drilling platform.
    • The M&I project award includes M&I low voltage Alternating Current (AC) Variable Frequency Drives (VFD).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM

    • Shares of Michaels are down 23% YTD.

  • TSLA

    Tesla sues former employee over stealing data

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) filed a lawsuit against a former employee for allegedly stealing gigabytes of data and making false claims about the company to the media.
    • The company filed the lawsuit in Nevada.
    • Shares of Tesla are up 1.32% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 393 Comments
  • STCN

    Steel Connect up 4% post Q3 results

    • Steel Connect (STCN +4.9%) reported Q3 revenue growth of 92.2% Y/Y to $188.92M due to the increase in revenue associated with the acquisition of IWCO Direct and offset by anticipated declines in supply chain business.
    • Sales by segment: Americas $13.06M (-35.3% Y/Y), Asia $31.82M (-14.13% Y/Y), Europe $22.94M (-33.06% Y/Y), Direct marketing $115.65M and e-Business $5.45M (-15.35 Y/Y).
    • Segment operating margins: Americas declined by 385 bps to -15.56%; Asia improved by 374 bps to 5.9%; Europe declined by 90 bps to -7.7%; Direct marketing was 8.6% and e-Business declined by 2,713 bps to -30.2%.
    • Q3 Overall margins: Gross improved by 1,190 bps to 20.6%, the improvement was due to the acquisition of IWCO Direct and higher gross margin in the Asia region; Operating margin recovered by 608 bps to 0.73% and Adj. EBITDA recovered by 1,262 bps to 8.9%.
    • SG&A expenses up by 110.80% Y/Y to $29.58M, reflecting costs associated with IWCO Direct acquisition.
    • “This marked the first full quarter with IWCO Direct and business has materialized as planned. IWCO Direct continues to show strong growth, particularly in the insurance vertical, and through process enhancements, their production efficiencies continue to improve”, commented Jim Henderson, CEO.
    • Previously: Steel Connect reports Q3 results (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • TST

    TheStreet +10.2% on sale of RateWatch for $33.5M

    • TheStreet (NASDAQ:TST) announces the sale of its RateWatch business to S&P Global (NYSE:SPGI) for $33.5M.
    • RateWatch provides over 4.2K bank and credit union clients with a deposit and loan rate database covering 100K locations going back 20 years. RateWatch has around 60 employees and last year’s revenues totaled $7.7M. 
    • TheStreet shares are up 10.2% to $1.94.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • FEYE

    FireEye +2% on Gigamon collab

    • FireEye (NASDAQ:FEYE) and Gigamon announce a global strategic partnership to combine FireEye’s Network Security with GigaSECURE Security Delivery Platform.
    • The joint solution is now available from both companies.   
    • FireEye shares are up 2% to $17.33.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM

    New Age Beverages +15% as uptrend continues

    • New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) is up 15.4% as the five-day uptrend in the beverage stock continues.
    • Shares of New Age are at their highest level since early April.
    • The company hasn't released any new financial information today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 28 Comments
  • XBIO

    Xenetic Biosciences up 9%

    • Ultra-thinly traded nano cap Xenetic Biosciences (XBIO +8.6%) is up on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 22K shares. No particular news accounts for the action.
    • At the end March, the company had ~$3.9M in cash while operations consumed ~$1.7M in Q1.
    • Update: Share are up 164% on Thursday, June 21, on a whopping 130x surge in volume. Long investors should be wary of an equity offering.

  • CLBS

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/20/2018)

    • Noble Group (OTCPK:NOBGF) soars as much as 63% in Singapore following a two-day trading halt, after saying shareholder Goldilocks Investment would support a revised proposal for a debt restructure the commodities trader sees as crucial to its survival.
    • Noble agreed to hand over a 70% equity stake in its restructured business to senior creditors in return for cutting its $3.4B debt in half.

    Helios watch: Reverse split, Gotti dud in the mix

    • Investors in Helios and Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) probably need to hold on tight as the volatile share price swings look likely to continue.
    • The company scheduled a special meeting at which it wants shareholder approval to effect a one-time reverse stock split at a ratio of 1-for-2 shares up to a ratio of 1-for-250. Helios also seeks to increase the number of shares authorized to 2B from 500M.
    • On a separate note, Helios' investment in Gotti through MoviePass Ventures doesn't appear to be paying off after the film only drew less than $2M in a limited release. Despite some heavy marketing from MoviePass, Gotti is being absolutely destroyed by reviewers. "It’s the ‘7-Minute Abs’ version of Goodfellas, but somehow so much worse than that sounds," writes IndieWire's David Erlich. "The film is pretty terrible: poorly written, devoid of tension, ridiculous in spots and just plain dull in others," chimes in The Hollywoood Reporter's Jordan Mintzer. It's a complicated formula though because in theory a slow box office for Gotti means a reduced level of payments back to exhibitors.
    • SEC Form 14A
    • Shares of Helios spiked 30% late yesterday to close at $0.44, but are back down 35.6% in premarket trading to $0.29.
